Package org.opensextant.giscore.input.kml

Class KmlBaseReader

java.lang.Object
org.opensextant.giscore.input.kml.KmlBaseReader
All Implemented Interfaces:
IKml
Direct Known Subclasses:
KmlReader
public abstract class KmlBaseReader extends Object implements IKml
URL rewriting logic extracted from KmlReader handles low-level rewriting URL href if relative link along with some other helper methods.

Makes best effort to resolve relative URLs but has some limitations such as if KML has nested chain of network links with mix of KML and KMZ resources. KMZ files nested inside KMZ files are not supported.

Author:
Jason Mathews, MITRE Corp. Date: Mar 30, 2009 12:04:01 PM

    • getLinkHref

      protected URI getLinkHref(UrlRef parent, TaggedMap links)
      Adjust Link href URL if httpQuery and/or viewFormat parameters are defined. Rewrites URL href if needed and returns URL as URI. Stores back href value in links TaggedMap if modifications were made to href otherwise left unchanged.
      Parameters:
      parent - Parent UrlRef from which to resolve relative URLs in links
      links - TaggedMap object containing href link
      Returns:
      adjusted href URL as URI, null if href is missing or empty string

    • setHttpQuery

      public static void setHttpQuery(String property, String value)
      Override the default values for the HttpQuery parameters (e.g. clientVersion). These are appended to URLs when importing NetworkLinks.

      Valid values to set are the following:

      • clientVersion
      • kmlVersion
      • clientName
      • language

      Use cautiously and set only legal values that a Google Earth client could actually send.
      For example, do not set KML version to value out of range or non-decimal values, etc. because it could have unanticipated consequences.

      See http://code.google.com/apis/kml/documentation/kmlreference.html#link

      Parameters:
      property - Property name, not null
      value - , never null
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if property is not valid or value is empty or null.

    • setDefaultViewFormat

      public static void setDefaultViewFormat(String property, String value)
      Override the default values for the ViewFormat parameters (e.g. bboxEast). These are appended to URLs when importing NetworkLinks.

      Valid property names are the following:

      • bboxEast
      • bboxNorth
      • bboxSouth
      • bboxWest
      • horizFov
      • horizPixels
      • lookatHeading
      • lookatLat
      • lookatLon
      • lookatRange
      • lookatTerrainAlt
      • lookatTerrainLat
      • lookatTerrainLon
      • lookatTilt
      • terrainEnabled
      • vertFov
      • vertPixels

      Use cautiously and set only legal values that a Google Earth client could actually send.
      For example, do not set bounding box to values out of range or non-decimal values, etc. because it could have unanticipated consequences.

      See http://code.google.com/apis/kml/documentation/kmlreference.html#link

      Parameters:
      property - Property name, not null
      value - , never null
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if property is not valid or value is empty or null.

    • setViewFormat

      public void setViewFormat(String property, String value)
      Override the default ViewFormat parameters for this KmlReader instance. Valid property names are the following:
      • bboxEast
      • bboxNorth
      • bboxSouth
      • bboxWest
      • horizFov
      • horizPixels
      • lookatHeading
      • lookatLat
      • lookatLon
      • lookatRange
      • lookatTerrainAlt
      • lookatTerrainLat
      • lookatTerrainLon
      • lookatTilt
      • terrainEnabled
      • vertFov
      • vertPixels
      Parameters:
      property - Property name, not null
      value - if null removes the override and used global default value instead
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if property is not valid or value is empty string

    • getBaseUrl

      public URL getBaseUrl()
      Get base URL of KML resource. May be null if URL is not applicable to the KML resource (e.g. internal byte stream).
